title: Framelover
author: Framelover
content: Good day everyone. First of all, I stand to be corrected cuz no one is an island.This post is directed to my fellow naija new comers in this forum. It‚Äôs sad that the idea SOME older members have of the newbies is that we just want to gather merits quickly which is most likely true with the kind and quality of posts and engagements most of the newbies make on the forum. This is to urge each and everyone of us to please create meaningful arguments/engage meaningfully on posts or topics on the forum so as to change this narrative and also boost our country‚Äôs reputation in the forum. There is no need to rush as there is milk and honey here if you engage meaningfully and you know what you are doing. Don‚Äôt just go to a post and reply ‚Äúnice topic‚Äù, ‚Äúgreat idea‚Äù etc just because you want to boost your activities as soon as possible.Also to our esteemed older members, I want to please urge y‚Äôall not to neglect the newbies cuz of this narrative. In as much as some just want to rush things, there are still individuals who create meaningful contents and engage meaningfully as well.¬† Don‚Äôt just see a post and when you realize it‚Äôs from a ‚Äònewbie‚Äô you ignore or trash it. Please let‚Äôs encourage one another at every level as we soar higher.Shalomü§ç

comments.author: Wiwo
comments.body: Quote from: Framelover on June 15, 2023, 08:02:41 PMSnip~Shalomü§çNice idea,¬† and just to point out something quickly,¬† please there is no need for newbies to create new topics every now and then all in the name of gaining from members' attention, or possibly getting rewarded. You can still get the best attention by making comments and contributions to existing topics that you find interesting and you have something to contribute to the discussion,¬† most of us at our newbies time also make such mistakes of creating threads,¬† while some were applauded others were condemned but we quickly learn from both and the lesson has helped to shape our activities here in the forum,¬† it necessary to have a mentor,¬† someone you can look up to for correction and advise and also making sure to get engage with Bitcoin and other cryptocurrency-related discussions more against other sub-board.

comments.author: CryptSafe
comments.body: Quote from: Framelover on June 15, 2023, 08:02:41 PM¬†Please let‚Äôs encourage one another at every level as we soar higher.Shalomü§çIt is good we be our brothers keeper. As you have said encouraging each other is a good idea to moving forward but I think this would be very much appreciated when it is reciprocated. No one would be that happy when after you have encouraged another with all your might and strength and when it gets to you it is a thing of being ignored. It is very disheartening and disappointing to experience such. An African proverbs says " when the left washes the right, the right reciprocates by washing the left as well" it is natural and can never be ignored or bypassed.

comments.author: sokani
comments.body: Thank you for the suggestion. Although, I consider myself as a new member and I believe that I still have many things to learn. At some point in this forum we all took our own baby steps, and we make some mistakes along the way and some of the corrections we got came as criticism, and regardless we got the message. As my our bigman Wiwo said, it doesn't really matter whether you started a topic or commented on someone else's topic, as long as you're making meaningful contribution on the local board or on the forum the merit will flow. Also, I know that our five star generals and other established members have been really kind in dishing out advice to newbies and meriting quality posts.

comments.author: Cryptomultiplier
comments.body: One way we can promote meaningful engagement in our local board is to pay attention to our local news, read and research on topics or phrases that are ambiguous. An empty head/brain may find it hard to create any engaging post, because it is garbage in garbage out.Newbies should do more reading on this forum. Look out for hot topics both internationally and locally that have an economic story, mostly when it concerns anything cryptocurrency or BTC, because that's what this forum is first of all about.Also, keeping a consistent style of writing and work presentation can really make a difference when it comes to meaningful engagement.

comments.author: Zanab247
comments.body: Quote from: FrameloverPlease let‚Äôs encourage one another at every level as we soar higher.Noted bro, I believe senior members and newbies will take something meaningful from dis your message because we need to grow higher in dis forum so that other local board will come and take advise from us. Well, some senior men here are trying their best to help newbies improve in quality Post, meaningful topic and comments which some has learned a lot to improve higher but some feel they are hurting dem from the forum by telling dem the right thing to do. But there are some senior members too, they don't want to use stuff mind to correct newbies to learn than to use some hot words that will make the person to give up or afraid to ask questions or make contribution in the forum. I believe we are almost there to become the best local board in the Bitcointalk.org because, I have go round many local board, I came to discovered that Nigeria local board is among the best.

So you have to develop yourself on Crypto related activities.

comments.author: BIT-BENDER
comments.body: Honestly I must say that I am very impressed and proud about the topics we are seeing here on the board so it's really shows that we have been able to grow. This is not to say that the board has been completely rid off those spam post, but the number has been cut down tremendously.I am really proud of the Nigerian representative here in the forum, we have been carrying ourselves in a very transparent and honorable manner. Remember when Nigerians use to be involved in issues especially that of plagiarism but right now all that has been reduced or even ended.

comments.author: Merit.s
comments.body: Normally, if you go somewhere new and you no take time observe the environment and the way them dey do things. If you go rush do things,e mean say u must fuck up because you no get the idea on how to make things work out for you there. Those newbies need to understand say na school them come. You never do your school registration finish,you come say na project you won do. How now,you go fuck up. Wetin I mean be say one step before another,first read and learn. Contribute for boards or topics were you get idea on and forget of creating topic first. When I start na so I dey do,I feel say na topic dey give more merits pass and na so,I just dey create. But now I don come understand say some comments dey even get 2 or more merits,where topic wey you take time create fit no even get one merit. So life na small small no hurry. Knowledge na power and na wetin the forum believe in.

comments.author: Marykeller
comments.body: Actually, no one is an island. None of us made it to the top without the help of others to shape their reasoning and direct their steps in the forum. Don't think that the older men wey d for the forum make their way to the top without starting as a newbie before they get to the level of exposure wey d get for the forum and crypto generally. In this life wey you see so. There is always a learning phase for everything wey peso get into before em go master am. That learning stage na newbie. Na base on your performance, patience and zeal go determine where you go fall to, whether to keep being a newbie or not. The choice d for the person handHaving said that sha, am beginning to the like the kind engage post wey the newbies d bring come this forum. Making una keep am up.Shalom
